titles.title: To designate the Federal building located at 799 United Nations Plaza in New York, New York, as the "Ronald H. Brown United States Mission to the United Nations Building".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.
Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 111-28.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 18.

action.text: Ms. Edwards (MD) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 837.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure
committee.subcommittee: Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management

bill.summary:
2/3/2009--Introduced.
Designates the federal building located at 799 United Nations Plaza in New York, New York, as the "Ronald H. Brown United States Mission to the United Nations Building."
